title: Stressed European Banks Could Hinder U.S. Markets
teaser: NPR's Marilyn Geewax discusses how actions in Europe could have ripple effects on U.S. markets. She'll also share the latest on gas prices.
contentencoded:
The European Bank stress test could have an impact on the U.S. economy as well. NPR’s Marilyn Geewax joins Here & Now‘s Jeremy Hobson to discuss how actions in Europe could have ripple effects on U.S. markets. She’ll also share the latest on gas prices, which fell below $3 a gallon at the start of this week — the lowest level in four years.

  • Related: Two Dozen European Banks Fail ‘Stress Test’

Guest

  • Marilyn Geewax, senior business editor for NPR. She tweets @geewaxnpr.
